title: Complementary and Alternative Medicine
cleaned_text: embark on your healing journey by allowing our Complementary and Alternative Medicine program into your life! While the Complementary and Alternative Medicine world includes numerous types of medicinal traditions, Santa Rosa Community Health offers four of the most common: - Acupuncture - Naturopathy - Chiropractic - Massage Your primary care provider will work with you on which modalities may work best with your medical conditions. Appointments are available in the evening. We look forward to working with you! Acupuncture Acupuncture has been around for several thousand years and has been proven to alleviate suffering for millions. There is extensive research on the acupuncture for medical needles in the surface of your skin. People often wonder or not the needles hurt— will experience achy feeling; this is normal and, in fact, is a good sign that it is working. Naturopathy Naturopathy is a form of medicine that focuses on the healing power of and stress management. You will meet with your naturopath provider to discuss your health issues, and then the naturopath will offer you fantastic recommendations on holistic treatments that you can try to enrich your health! Massage Massage is a familiar modality that includes many different styles (deep tissue, Swedish, etc). It utilizes strokes and pressure on the body to relieve tension, increase circulation and improve massages. Chiropractic Chiropractic services are based on a system of care that emphasizes the importance of structural alignment of the and joints
